page.title: 01OUNDLE BLOCK - SUMMARY
page.content: In the block there are four villages and one town. The town is Oundle and the villages are Ashton, Tansor, Warmington and Cotterstock. The River Nene which flows to the Wash is a meandering river passing south of Oundle. This is not a heavily populated area. Most people live in Oundle and the villages and work locally although some commute to London.The main land-cover is arable with grazing land close behind. What little industry there is here results from agriculture. The major land-owner is the Ashton Estate. The other institution of note in the block is Oundle School which provides work and swells the population by approximately a thousand in term-time. The major activity of 1985 is the building of the by-pass along the old railway line.
